greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = n^21 mod 100.
comment: Also n^(20k+1) mod 100 for any positive integer k.
There are 63 numbers (075821) where the final two digits of n^21, n^41, n^61, etc. are equal to n.
example: a(11) = 11 since 11^21 = 7400249944258160101211 and the final two digits are 11.
results.author: _Henry Bottomley_, Nov 25 2004
